results.title: Jenny
results.creator_credit: Patricia Phillips, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
Part of a series of six short dramas for adolescents and adults on teenage alienation, Jenny is the story of a seemingly tough seventeen-year-old who is arrested for trafficking drugs. Jenny’s story emerges as she is interviewed by a skilful social worker. Her unemployed, alcoholic father has been sexually abusing her, and is now turning his attention to her weaker, younger sister as well.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Phillips, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Magic place
results.creator_credit: David Briggs, Kathy Whelan, Linton Briggs and Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE
results.brief_description:
Narrated to a background of archival home movie images juxtaposed with contemporary images of Lake Mokoan and the surrounding landscape, local resident Linton Briggs gives his account of the changes which have taken place since the decommissioning of the Lake. He speaks of a magic place, Winton Swamp, where wildlife was in abundance, where a wet-land ecosystem of bird-life, Murray cod, Red-gums, and every variety of duck imaginable used to exist and of his sadness and apprehension the changing of the lake may make to the ecological balance of Lake Mokoan.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Darren's day out
results.brief_description:
A journey through Darren’s colorful Koori paintings of Gippsland. His images depict his visit to Metung rocks, Kalimna and an Emu Farm, and through text, Darren conveys his thoughts and impressions of his day out.
No dialogue only baclground sound effects.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: We used to call them Blackboys
results.creator_credit: Maz McGann and Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE
results.brief_description: Using photographic images, this story of the grass trees growing on the ranges outside Wangaratta becomes a poetic meditation on how a person’s ideas on place can change with understanding and compassion. European insensitivity and ignorance of the past has been replaced with political awareness and correctness, a sense of the land and the environment and a desire for reconciliation with those who belonged to the land before the invasion of the white man. A sensitive and thought-provoking piece. Made as part of Regional Arts Victoria’s Bute Utes - the Movie program.

results.title: Selection of titles from the Inala Straford Home Movie Archive Collection
results.brief_description: Diverse productions made by brothers Frank and John Straford in their Brighton Backyard between 1951 and 1956. Without formal training and using the most basic of equipment and self invented production techniques, the brothers produced an irresistible array of short animations, scripted dramas and home movies that have a freshness and charm 50 years later.
results.title_for_label: Selection of titles from the Inala Straford Home Movie Archive Collection
results.description: Diverse productions made by brothers Frank and John Straford in their Brighton Backyard between 1951 and 1956. Without formal training and using the most basic of equipment and self invented production techniques, the brothers produced an irresistible array of short animations, scripted dramas and home movies that have a freshness and charm 50 years later.

group_works.title: Little Claude - a'hunting he will go

results.title: My grandfather's country
results.creator_credit: Edie Terrick, Elaine Terrick, Lisa Roberts and Poogie Hayes
results.brief_description:
Elaine Terrick’s mum, Edie Terrick, takes a journey back to the place she calls her grandfather’s country - in the mountainous ranges of Gippsland, Victoria. A place where her grandfather survived the slaughtering of his aboriginal people and where he as an abandoned child was found by white people - the O’Rourke family - taken in and brought up as an O’Rourke. For Edie it is an emotional but rewarding journey. Contains beautiful images of the high country and of the “place” where Edi’s grandfather grew up.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Selective breeding
results.brief_description:
Investigates the deliberate breeding of particular characteristics into different animals. Discusses the idea that many fashionable characteristics can lead to animals which are not functional. Also looks at the breeding of horses and chickens with breeders outlining some of the methods used to produce or maintain particular characterisitics.
Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Selections from a child's garden of verses
results.creator_credit: Robert Louis Stevenson, Wil Berg and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Wildberg, who made this film, reads excerpts from Robert Louis Stevenson’s collection including “I have a little shadow” and “The Swing”, while a boy experiences or watches others experience the emotions and sensations of the poems

results.title: Journey
results.brief_description: Inspired by Gary’s neighbour Tony, who emigrated from Italy in 1952. Describes what people had to go through in search of a better life in Australia.
